Instruction: Modify the vector graphics in the file named "B56FX21.pdf" on page 4, targeting the 3rd rectangle. Select vectors from the "rebar" class using Window mode. Change the stroke color to red, stroke width to 2.0 pt, and set the line type to dashed.
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "B56FX21.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Instantiate annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc)

# Extract the target rectangle
pagenumber = 3  # Page 4 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 2  # 3rd rectangle (0-based index)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Prepare arguments for the vector update task
argument = dict(clip=rectangle, drwcolor="red", width=2.0, dashes="[3 3]0")

# Create a selector for the specified vectors
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

# Select rebars using Window mode
covered_rebars = selector.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Manipulate vectors with the specified attributes
manipulator = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=covered_rebars, drwcolor=argument.get("drwcolor"), dashes=argument.get("dashes"), width=argument.get("width"))

# Update the document with the manipulated vectors
doc = manipulator.update_draw()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "J7RT12L.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Instantiate annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc)

# Extract the target rectangle
pagenumber = 7  # Page 8 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 1  # 2nd rectangle (0-based index)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Prepare arguments for the vector update task
argument = dict(clip=rectangle, fillcolor="yellow", lineJoin=2, dashes="[0 0]0")

# Create a selector for the specified vectors
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

# Select rebars and columns using Cross mode
intersected_rebars = selector.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
intersected_columns = selector.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

# Manipulate rebars
manipulator_rebars = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=intersected_rebars, 
                                           fillcolor=argument.get("fillcolor"), lineJoin=argument.get("lineJoin"), 
                                           dashes=argument.get("dashes"))
doc = manipulator_rebars.update_draw()

# Manipulate columns
manipulator_columns = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=intersected_columns, 
                                            fillcolor=argument.get("fillcolor"), lineJoin=argument.get("lineJoin"), 
                                            dashes=argument.get("dashes"))
doc = manipulator_columns.update_draw()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import PDFbf

# File information

import fitz
import PDFbf

recorder1_1 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information='''file-level: O5YZ89.pdf, page-level: 2, order-level: 3, base-level: Select 'column' class vectors using Window mode (incomplete)''')

annoextractor2 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc2)
pagenumber2 = 5  # Page 6 (0-based index)
rectangleorder2 = 3  # Rectangle 4 (0-based index)
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor2.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# "line" class, Cross mode
# Assumed line endings: semi-circle, Assumed stroke width: 1.5 pt
argument2_1 = dict(clip=rectangle2, width=1.5, lineCap=1)

                                       width=argument2_1.get("width"), lineCap=argument2_1.get("lineCap"))

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Command 1

# Object 1: "J4QR78.pdf", Page 6, Rectangle 3
filepath1 = "J4QR78.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)
annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc1)
pagenumber1 = 5  # Page 6 (0-based index)
rectangleorder1 = 2  # Rectangle 3 (0-based index)
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: "rebar" vectors, Cross mode
stroke_width_rebar = 2.0  # Assumed width
stroke_color_rebar = "darkred"  # Assumed subtle color adjustment
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=rectangle1)
intersected_rebars = selector1.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=intersected_rebars, 
                                     width=stroke_width_rebar, drwcolor=stroke_color_rebar)
doc1 = manipulator1.update_draw()

# Group 2: "column" vectors, Window mode
fill_color_column = "lightgray"  # Assumed fill adjustment
line_type_column = "[3 3]0"  # Assumed dashed line type
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=rectangle1)
covered_columns = selector2.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_columns, 
                                     fillcolor=fill_color_column, dashes=line_type_column)
doc1 = manipulator2.update_draw()

# Group 3: "line" vectors, Cross mode
line_joint_line = 1  # Assumed rounded joints
line_cap_line = 1  # Assumed semi-circle line ends
selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=rectangle1)
intersected_lines = selector3.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc1, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=intersected_lines, 
                                     lineJoin=line_joint_line, lineCap=line_cap_line)
doc1 = manipulator3.update_draw()
updated_file1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updated_file1)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File information
filepath = "A9XY45.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc)

# Rectangle information
pagenumber = 2  # Page 3 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 6  # Rectangle 7 (0-based index)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Group 1: Cross mode for "rebar" class vectors
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle, width=2.0, drwcolor="blue")
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
intersected_rebars = selector1.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=intersected_rebars, width=argument1.get("width"), drwcolor=argument1.get("drwcolor"))
doc = manipulator1.update_draw()

# Group 2: Window mode for "column" class vectors
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle, fillcolor="red", dashes="[3 3]0")
covered_columns = selector1.mode1_columns_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=covered_columns, fillcolor=argument2.get("fillcolor"), dashes=argument2.get("dashes"))
doc = manipulator2.update_draw()

# Group 3: Cross mode for "line" class vectors
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle, lineCap=1, width=1.5)
intersected_lines = selector1.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=intersected_lines, lineCap=argument3.get("lineCap"), width=argument3.get("width"))
doc = manipulator3.update_draw()

# Save updated file
updatedfilepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updatedfilepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "B6LM12.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Instantiate annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc)

# Extract the target rectangle
pagenumber = 4  # Page 5 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 1  # 2nd rectangle (0-based index)
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Group 1: Cross mode for "column"
argument1 = dict(clip=rectangle, width=3.0, lineJoin=1)
selector1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument1.get("clip"))
intersected_columns = selector1.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
manipulator1 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=intersected_columns, 
                                     width=argument1.get("width"), lineJoin=argument1.get("lineJoin"))
doc = manipulator1.update_draw()

# Group 2: Window mode for "line"
argument2 = dict(clip=rectangle, fillcolor="green", closePath=True)
selector2 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument2.get("clip"))
covered_lines = selector2.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator2 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, sel_drawings=covered_lines, 
                                     fillcolor=argument2.get("fillcolor"), closePath=argument2.get("closePath"))
doc = manipulator2.update_draw()

# Group 3: Cross mode for "rebar"
argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle, dashes="[0 0]0", drwcolor="black")
selector3 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument3.get("clip"))
intersected_rebars = selector3.mode2_rebars_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

                                     dashes=argument3.get("dashes"), drwcolor=argument3.get("drwcolor"))
doc = manipulator3.update_draw()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"

import fitz
import PDFbf

filepath = "Q2AB78.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc)
pagenumber1 = 3  # Page 4 (0-based index)
rectangleorder1 = 2  # Rectangle 3 (0-based index)
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# Group 1: "rebar" vectors, Window mode
argument1_1 = dict(clip=rectangle1, drwcolor="red", width=2.0)
selector1_1 = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, clip=argument1_1.get("clip"))
covered_drawings1_1 = selector1_1.mode1_drawings_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator1_1 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_drawings1_1, 
                                       drwcolor=argument1_1.get("drwcolor"), width=argument1_1.get("width"))
doc = manipulator1_1.update_draw()

recorder1_2 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information='''file-level: Q2AB78.pdf, page-level: 4, order-level: 3, base-level: Select "line" class vectors. Set fill color to blue.(incomplete)''')
recorder1_2.recording()


argument3 = dict(clip=rectangle1, lineCap=2, width=1.5)
covered_drawings1_2 = selector1_1.mode1_drawings_Window_Cover_Enclosure()
manipulator3 = PDFbf.manipulate_draw(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber1, sel_drawings=covered_drawings1_2, lineCap=argument3.get("lineCap"), width=argument3.get("width"))
doc = manipulator3.update_draw()


recorder2_2 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information='''file-level: Q2AB78.pdf, page-level: 10, order-level: missing, base-level: Select "line" class vectors using Cross mode. Set stroke width to 2.5 pt and fill color to yellow.''')
recorder2_2.recording()

# Group 2: "rebar" vectors, Window mode
recorder2_2 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information='''file-level: Q2AB78.pdf, page-level: 10, order-level: missing, base-level: Select 'rebar' class vectors using Window mode (incomplete)''')
recorder2_2.recording()

recorder2_2 = PDFbf.recorder(missing_information='''file-level: Q2AB78.pdf, page-level: 10, order-level: missing, base-level: Select "column" class vectors using Window mode. Set line joint type to cut-off and stroke color to orange.''')
recorder2_2.recording()
